court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
judgment_text:
:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION

OFFICIAL OFFICIAL OFFICIAL ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 80 OF 1964 NO. 80 OF 1964 NO. 80 OF 1964

Re: Dhirajlal Jiwanlal Parekh.

... Insolvent.

....

Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

th th th DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 1st October,

.

Pro-rata preferential dividend of .100 ps.

in

a

rupee

was

declared on th August, , .04 ps.

in

a

rupee

was declared on th December and .02 ps.

in

a

rupee

was

declared

on th October

.

The

cash

balance in hand is Rs.2,842.82 ps.

against a preferential

proved

liability

of

Rs.1160.56

ps.

and

unsecured

liability of Rs.5,33,343/-. In the present case, no

further recoveries are possible.

:2:

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that the balance

amount

of

Rs.2,842.82

ps.

may be

transferred

to

the

unclaimed

dividend capital account under Rule of

the

Bombay

Insolvency

Rules, and

thereafter

to

the

unclaimed dividend capital revenue account and the account

may

be closed for administrative purposes.

Having regard

to the circumstances set out in the report of the Official

Assignee,

there is no reason why the prayer should not be

granted. Prayer Clause (a) of the report of the Official

Assignee is accordingly granted.

-----
